content: joe senior s october snowstorm hat by leah addis i made this hat for my father- in-law since he and the boys don t stop working outside just because of a little snow the double slip_stitch used in this pattern makes the hat look a bit like it was knitted and it gives the hat some stretch the combination of double_crochet and double slip stitches results in a lovely thick texture perfect for those winter months and even the early snowstorms gauge not crucial this hat is worked flat as a rectangle then seamed up the edge and at the top it s made long to create a brim and allow the hat to fit most adult sizes i learned the technique of alternating double_crochet with double slip stitches from reneé barnes v-neck topper pattern this project will use about 250 yards of medium weight yarn more or less depending on the size of the hat being made and an h hook i used lion brand fisherman s wool for lots of warmth and comfort stitches used double_crochet double slip_stitch double slip_stitch insert hook into the same stitch you just worked in and draw up a loop insert hook into next stitch draw up another loop and pull this loop through the other two loops on your hook row 1 chain 60 this is the height of the hat so for a shorter brim chain 50 or less as needed chain 3 more and turn row 2 skip 3 chain then double_crochet in each chain across chain 1 turn row 3 single_crochet in first stitch then double slip_stitch across single_crochet in last stitch chain 3 turn row 4 working in back loops only double_crochet in each stitch across repeat row 3 and 4 until the piece is the proper size to fit around the head of the recipient remember to take yarn stretchiness into consideration once it s at the proper length end after row 3 seam the hat together by lining up the first and last row and sewing through the back loops only of the last row this will help hide the seam gather the top and sew through opposite points to draw them together and create a nice even gather secure well and weave in ends fold up the brim to the desired size and enjoy note please enjoy making as many hats as you d like and please feel free to sell hats made with this pattern but please do not sell the pattern in any way thank you
